title: Is '旭日' a possible Japanese last name? How would you write it in Hiragana? - Quora

response.answer_text: My first instinct was あさひ as in 旭川 (Asahikawa) and 旭産業 (Asahi Sangyo [Industries]), but it turns out that it’s more often rendered as きょくじつ。 If it were used as a surname, the あさひ reading would be most natural. However, it feels incomplete as if it needs another element of nature included afterward.
The thing I love about Yomi (Japanese reading of the kanji), is that it can be read like: KyokujitsuAsabiAkibiTerubiKokugaIt has a lot of readings
